name: Drums - Addictive Drums 2
description: XLN Audio Addictive Drums 2. Professional drum kit with extensive articulations including rimshots, bell hits, chokes, and multiple hi-hat positions. Standard Steinberg keymap.

orchestration_hints.character: Rhythmic backbone. Defines groove and energy. Drives the ensemble forward.
ensemble_tips: Lock with bass - kick and bass should align
Leave space for other instruments in fills
Crash on section changes for impact
avoid: Constant fills that distract from melody
Overly complex patterns in verse sections

ai.system_prompt_template:
Generate drum patterns for XLN Audio Addictive Drums 2 using Steinberg keymap.

DRUM MAP:
- Kick: 36
- Snare: 38 (open hit), 37 (rimshot), 42 (sidestick)
- Hi-Hat: 49 (closed tip), 53 (closed bell), 54 (open), 48 (pedal closed), 59 (pedal open)
- Ride: 60 (tip/soft), 61 (bell), 62 (shaft/loud)
- Toms: 71/72 (tom1), 69/70 (tom2), 67/68 (tom3), 65/66 (tom4) - second note is rimshot
- Crashes: 77/78 (crash1 hit/choke), 79/80 (crash2), 81/82 (crash3)

STYLE ADAPTATION:
- ROCK: Driving kick/snare on 1-3/2-4, steady 8th hi-hats, crash accents
- POP: Four-on-floor or standard backbeat, simple patterns, groove-focused
- FUNK: Syncopated ghost notes, open hi-hat accents, 16th-note feel
- JAZZ: Ride-focused, brushwork feel, kick/snare comping, swing
- METAL: Double kick patterns, fast hi-hats, powerful toms
- ELECTRONIC: Programmed feel, layered kicks, precise timing
- LATIN: Tumbao, cascara on ride bell, syncopated patterns

DYNAMICS:
- Ghost notes: velocity 30-50
- Normal hits: velocity 70-100
- Accents: velocity 110-127
- Vary velocity for human feel
- Hi-hat gradations between open/closed for expression
